Beginner Vocabulary - Page 4

Beginner

Beginner Vocabulary - Page 4

Learn essential time-related vocabulary that you'll use every day. These words help you talk about when things happen!

Navigation

This is page 4 of 9. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Time

/taɪm/

noun

The thing that is measured in minutes, hours, days, etc.

"What time is it?"

Category: Time

Day

/deɪ/

noun

A period of 24 hours.

"Today is a beautiful day."

Category: Time

Night

/naɪt/

noun

The time when it is dark and people usually sleep.

"Good night, sleep well."

Category: Time

Morning

/ˈmɔːrnɪŋ/

noun

The early part of the day from sunrise to noon.

"I exercise every morning."

Category: Time

Evening

/ˈiːvnɪŋ/

noun

The part of the day between afternoon and night.

"We have dinner in the evening."

Category: Time

Today

/təˈdeɪ/

adverb, noun

On this day; the present day.

"Today is Monday."

Category: Time

Tomorrow

/təˈmɑːroʊ/

adverb, noun

On the day after today.

"I have a meeting tomorrow."

Category: Time

Yesterday

/ˈjɛstərdeɪ/

adverb, noun

On the day before today.

"I went shopping yesterday."

Category: Time

Week

/wiːk/

noun

A period of seven days.

"I work five days a week."

Category: Time

Month

/mʌnθ/

noun

One of the twelve periods that a year is divided into.

"January is the first month of the year."

Category: Time

Year

/jɪr/

noun

A period of 365 or 366 days.

"I was born in the year 1990."

Category: Time

Hour

/aʊər/

noun

A period of 60 minutes.

"The meeting lasted one hour."

Category: Time

Page 4 of 9
